heroIntro:
Welcome to your family home in Villas de la Romana, a carefully planned residential community designed with families in mind. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa offers 135m² of thoughtfully designed living space, set on a generous 500m² plot—perfect for children to play safely and your family to grow. At €345,000, this property represents exceptional value at €2,556/m², which is 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets, giving your family premium quality without premium prices.

Located in the heart of La Romana's family-friendly neighborhoods, this villa combines modern convenience with the relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle. The safe, established community features excellent international schools, reliable healthcare facilities, and all the amenities families need for everyday living. Whether you're seeking a permanent family home or a property that generates rental income during summer months, this villa delivers both comfort and financial sense. With 23 high-quality images showcasing every detail, you'll see why families are choosing to make La Romana their home.
areaSection: La Romana sits in the heart of the Costa Blanca, approximately 50km south of Alicante city. This established residential area combines the best of coastal living with inland tranquility—close enough to beaches for weekend trips, yet far enough inland to avoid overdevelopment and maintain strong community values. The town benefits from excellent year-round weather with over 320 days of sunshine annually, creating an ideal climate for families. La Romana has evolved from a quiet agricultural area into a thriving residential hub, attracting families and retirees who appreciate its authentic Spanish character mixed with modern infrastructure. The region's elevation offers refreshing breezes in summer, while winters remain mild and pleasant. Surrounded by the natural beauty of inland Alicante, La Romana provides access to pine forests, agricultural landscapes, and charming local traditions—all within a 30-minute drive of world-class beaches.
lifestyleSection: Life in La Romana revolves around community, family time, and outdoor activities. The established expat population means you'll find English spoken widely, and there's a genuine sense of international community without losing local Spanish character. Your daily routine might include morning coffee at a local café, shopping at Mercadona or the weekly market for fresh produce, and afternoon activities with children in safe, open spaces. Families particularly appreciate the excellent international schools and English-speaking healthcare professionals available throughout the area. Evenings often involve dinner on a terrace as the Mediterranean sun sets, with restaurants serving everything from authentic Spanish paella to international cuisine. The beaches—all within 20 minutes—are perfect for weekend escapes, while golf courses nearby offer leisure activities for adults. The cost of living is refreshingly reasonable compared to northern Europe, with supermarkets like Consum and Lidl offering excellent value. The community is genuinely family-oriented, with neighbors who understand the challenges of raising children abroad and who create a supportive environment.
investmentSection: Beyond being an excellent family home, this villa represents a sound investment in an appreciating property market. La Romana has experienced consistent growth of 8% year-on-year, outpacing many other Costa Blanca areas. The property's premium specification at below-market pricing positions it well for capital appreciation. For families considering rental income, similar properties in the area command €800 per week during peak summer season—translating to significant returns during school holidays when many families seek Mediterranean rentals. Unlike coastal resort properties that suffer seasonality issues, La Romana's residential character attracts longer-term rentals and repeat visitors. The combination of affordable purchase price, growing market demand, and strong rental potential creates a compelling investment case alongside your family's lifestyle benefits.
conclusion:
This 3-bedroom villa in La Romana represents exactly what many UK families are searching for: affordable Mediterranean living without compromising on quality, safety, or access to excellent schools and healthcare. At €345,000 with premium specifications, you're securing both a comfortable family home and a sound investment in an appreciating property market. healthcare.text: Healthcare in the La Romana area is comprehensive and family-friendly. The Regional Hospital Vega Baja, located approximately 30 minutes away, provides full emergency and specialist services with modern facilities comparable to UK standards. Private clinics throughout the area offer additional options with shorter wait times and English-speaking medical professionals. The community has numerous family doctors and pediatricians familiar with expat families' needs. Prescription medications are affordable and readily available at pharmacies. Many medical professionals have trained internationally or speak English fluently, eliminating language barriers for health consultations. The Spanish healthcare system is highly regarded globally, and residents have access to both public and private options depending on insurance coverage.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions, including British nationals. The process is straightforward: obtain a Spanish tax ID number (NIE), have a lawyer review the purchase agreement, arrange financing if needed, and complete the property registration. No visa is required specifically for property purchase, and many international buyers successfully navigate the process with professional guidance.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 10-12% in additional costs including: property transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.5%), and legal fees (1-2%). For a €345,000 property, total acquisition costs would be roughly €35,000-€41,000 additional. These costs are predictable and clearly itemized. Professional legal guidance ensures transparency and protects your interests throughout the purchase process.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Costa Blanca is an excellent property market, particularly for families. The region offers year-round sunshine (320+ days annually), affordable cost of living compared to northern Europe, excellent healthcare and international schools, and proven property market appreciation (8% year-on-year in this area). The established expat community means strong support networks for relocated families, while the genuine Spanish character prevents it from feeling like an isolated expatriate enclave.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than the UK—typically 25-35% less expensive depending on your lifestyle choices. Groceries at supermarkets like Mercadona offer exceptional value, dining out remains affordable, and utilities cost considerably less. For families, this means school fees, activities, and holidays stretch further. €1,200-€1,500 monthly covers comfortable living expenses for a couple beyond mortgage/rent, while families typically budget €1,800-€2,500 depending on choices.

faqs.question: Как далеко Коста-Бланка от России?
faqs.answer: Alicante is approximately 1,400 kilometers (870 miles) south of London. Direct flights from UK airports to Alicante take approximately 2.5 hours, making it easily accessible for regular UK visits. Many families maintain this property while keeping UK connections through convenient flights. The time zone difference is just one hour (Spain is UTC+1 in winter, UTC+2 in summer), eliminating jet lag challenges for UK family visits.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys outstanding year-round weather with over 320 days of sunshine annually. Summers (June-September) are warm and dry, averaging 28-32°C. Winters (December-February) are mild, averaging 12-15°C—virtually no snow or ice. Autumn and spring are particularly pleasant at 20-25°C. Rainfall is minimal and concentrated in autumn/spring. This consistent, moderate climate is perfect for families wanting Mediterranean living without extreme heat, supporting outdoor activities throughout the year.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages, though terms differ from UK lending. Spanish lenders typically offer 70-80% loan-to-value financing to foreign buyers, compared to 95% for Spanish residents. Interest rates are competitive, often lower than UK rates. Lenders require proof of income, employment contracts, and credit history. Working with a mortgage advisor familiar with international buyers simplifies the process. Many families combine Spanish mortgage with UK savings for larger deposits, resulting in favorable borrowing terms.

faqs.question: Is La Romana good for families relocating from the UK?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. La Romana is specifically popular with UK families for several reasons: established English-speaking community providing support networks, British curriculum international schools nearby, safe residential neighborhoods with low traffic, excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors, and cost of living allowing families to maintain higher quality of life than in the UK. The relaxed Mediterranean pace supports family time, while modern amenities ensure you're not sacrificing convenience for lifestyle. Many families describe it as having 'found their people' within the expat community here.

faqs.question: What is the rental income potential for this villa?
faqs.answer: Similar properties in La Romana command approximately €800 per week during peak summer months (June-September), potentially generating €12,000-€15,000 per season. Off-season (October-May) typically attracts €400-€600 weekly rates. With professional property management, an owner might achieve €12,000-€18,000 annual rental income after management fees and operating costs. This provides realistic returns while maintaining the property as your family's Mediterranean home during your own vacation periods. Many families find this rental income offset property costs substantially.
